H0.text: Heat energy is the least available for reuse in a food web, because energy flows in an ecosystem through food webs.

H1.text: Sunlight energy is the least available for reuse in a food web, as energy flows in an ecosystem through food webs.

H2.text: Energy from producers is the least available for reuse in a food web, because energy flows in an ecosystem through food webs.

H3.text: Energy from consumers is the least available for reuse in a food web, because energy flows in an ecosystem through food webs.

A4.text: Energy is lost as heat at each step along the way.

A5.text: Of all the net primary productivity at the producer trophic level, in general only 10% goes to the next level

A6.text: Eventually, all the energy in a food chain is dispersed as heat.
